item.title: Redrawing Vim Screen
item.description: Part of my current workflow for web development is writing code in NeoVim in an iTerm2 Terminal on one screen and checking results in the browser on another screen. The screens are virtual and can be changed using Cmd + ← and Cmd + →. I reload a browser tab using Cmd + R. When switching screens and reloading is down quickly it happens that the Cmd + R hits the terminal which results in a nicely cleared terminal.
